lines.transliteration_english: Daykhi Daykhi Drigan Daras Mahimaa N Jaanee , Soun Soun Sabadu Mahaatam N Jaaniao Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing many colourful festivities with eyes, an ignorant person could not appreciate the glory of the glimpse of the True Guru. He did not even learn the importance of Naam Simran, having heard praises and slanders all the times.

lines.gurmukhi: gwie gwie gMimqw gun gn gun inDwn his his pRym ko pRqwpu n pCwinE hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gaai Gaai Ganmitaa Goun Gan Goun Nidhaana , Hasi Hasi Praym Ko Prataapu N Pachhaaniao Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Singing praises of worldly things and people day and night, he did not reach the ocean of virtues-the True Guru. He wasted his time in idle talks and laughs but did not recognise the wondrous love of the True Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: roie roie ibrhw ibEg ko n sog jwinE mn gih gih mnu muGdu n mwinE hY
lines.transliteration_english: Roi Roi Birahaa Biaog Ko N Sog Jaaniao , Man Gahi Gahi Manu Moughadu N Maaniao Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Wailing and crying for maya, he spent his life-time but never felt the pangs of separation of the True Guru. The mind remained engrossed in the worldly affairs but it was foolish enough not to take the refuge of the True Guru.
